text:
“I can’t help thinking you are still delirious.”  
“I am delirious? You are fibbing, my cock-sparrow!”  
“Do you find me curious?”  
“Yes, curious.”  
“Shall I tell you what I was reading?”  
Zametov leaned in. “What is it?”  
“Prick up your ears?”  
“How do you mean—‘prick up my ears’?”  
“I confess… I was searching for news of the murder.”  
He leaned closer. “The old pawnbroker woman.”  
Zametov stared, unmoving.  
Silence stretched between them.  
“What if you have been reading about it?” Zametov asked, confused.  
“That same old woman,” Raskolnikov whispered.  
“Do you understand now?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov confesses to Zametov that he has been searching for news about the murder of the old pawnbroker woman.
